critique: This document is an amendment to a previous executive order (No. 11808) that allows the President to designate additional members to serve on the Board and the Executive Committee. Without knowing the specifics of Executive Order No. 11808, it's difficult to assess the full impact of this amendment. However, the amendment itself appears to expand executive power by granting the President more control over the composition of the Board and Executive Committee. There is no information available to assess the document's stance on immigration, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, or social inclusion. The document does not seem to have a strong ideological tilt.
